body:
I understand that if you look at this from the "0, 1, 2, .." perspective then the "return 0 things" seems to be a special case of "return N things". 

What I'm saying is that it's a stretch to consider the "return nothing" case as a "return 0 things" just so you can group it with all the others (return 1, etc..). "return nothing" is fundamentally different from all the other things you are grouping it with. That's why IMO is not a "silly special case". You can "return nothing" or "return something". Those are very different things.

That's why I personally don't find the current behaviour strange or inconsistent.
